Body: Possible Duplicate:  Restore only part of nandroid image  I recently wiped my phone and installed MIUI.us. Before wiping it, I made a backup img using ROM Manager.However, I'd like to transfer some of my applications' data so its available on the new install (like color notes, google tracks, for instance).Is there a way to extract the relevant data from the img file, or some way to selectively back them up before wiping the phone and restore them after I replace the ROM?
Title: How do I import user data from a ROM Manager backup?

history.Text: I recently wiped my phone and installed MIUI.us. Before wiping it, I made a backup img using ROM Manager.However, I'd like to transfer some of my applications' data so its available on the new install (like color notes, google tracks, for instance).Is there a way to extract the relevant data from the img file, or some way to selectively back them up before wiping the phone and restore them after I replace the ROM?
How do I import user data from a ROM Manager backup?

> **Possible Duplicate:**  > [Restore only part of nandroid image](http://android.stackexchange.com/questions/7851/restore-only-part-of-nandroid-image)  I recently wiped my phone and installed MIUI.us. Before wiping it, I made a backup img using ROM Manager.However, I'd like to transfer some of my applications' data so its available on the new install (like color notes, google tracks, for instance).Is there a way to extract the relevant data from the img file, or some way to selectively back them up before wiping the phone and restore them after I replace the ROM?
